purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to remote servers via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses from os.networkInterfaces() -> macAddresses array -> Buffer.from() -> base64 string
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains in _tmp_2 array
Sending system identifiers to external domains without user consent
HTTP GET requests to external domains with system data
analysis: This code performs system fingerprinting by collecting MAC addresses, hostname, and user information. It then sends this sensitive data to known command and control (C2) domains using unverified HTTP requests. The presence of hardcoded malicious domains and disabling of SSL validation indicates potential malicious intent. The code also uses base64 encoding for data transmission, suggesting attempts at obfuscation.
conclusion: This code demonstrates clear malicious behavior by collecting system information and exfiltrating it to external C2 servers without user knowledge or consent.
